messages.message:
I've been testing out the Translation App (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C03N2DF2FT4/p1697626313982179), and overall it's awesome - kudos here to @jayasooryan and team! Very positive first signs, and already got a couple of prospects asking for a demo on it. Wanted to share a few points of feedback on top of that:
• Would be great to have the option for it to detect the language, or translate from multiple languages within one doc to one consistent language.
• Preferably the docs would scroll at the same time so you can keep the relative position of both (like it does in reader).
• I'd prefer if the chosen languages stay after you leave the page. Currently it jumps back to English to German as default setting after you leave the page.
• Status bar doesn't load, just jumps straight to the end.

This is great feedback, the current app is very experimental, and these are all improvements that we want to make!

But before investing further, it'll be useful to learn more about how prospects are interested in using this app and size the potential business here. Would you be able to share more info about the prospects that you've seen?
Thanks @avi  - I will share those details in a week or so after meeting with the prospects

Echoing Tom's feedback here!

I have a prospect looking to translate Thai docs into english. Currently, I see the possibility to translate from english to thai but not the inverse. Is Thai a language we're looking to add?

She's interested in the context of KYC docs that need to be understood by agents in their local language or in english

We are using different components (OCR, form recognizer, Microsoft translate API, etc.) to do document translation. Supported languages are determined by taking the intersection of languages supported by all the components.

We are currently limited by the language support of components here. We can support more language pairs when these individual components support more languages!
